dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Hey, B, have you heard the news about the Mangilik El Triumphal Arch in Astana?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Hey, B, have you heard the news about the Mangilik El Triumphal Arch in Astana?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, um, no, I don't think so. What's up with it?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, um, no, I don't think so. What's up with it?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, the observation deck there, which has been closed for, like, three years now... it's finally going to reopen!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, the observation deck there, which has been closed for, like, three years now... it's finally going to reopen!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The observation deck at the Triumphal Arch stopped operating in 2022. Now, after 3 years, it will once again open its doors to the public.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Three years? Wow. I didn't even realize it had been shut down for so long. [interrupts] What was the deal?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Three years? Wow. I didn't even realize it had been shut down for so long. What was the deal?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, um, it's been undergoing repairs. The Astana Department of Construction and Housing Policy just confirmed it.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, um, it's been undergoing repairs. The Astana Department of Construction and Housing Policy just confirmed it.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Astana Department of Construction and Housing Policy told Tengrinews.kz that the arch is currently undergoing repairs.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Okay, repairs. Makes sense. So, when can people actually go back up there?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Okay, repairs. Makes sense. So, when can people actually go back up there?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: They're saying construction work should be completed by the *end* of 2026. So, still a bit of a wait.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: They're saying construction work should be completed by the end of twenty twenty six. So, still a bit of a wait.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Construction work is expected to be completed by the end of 2026.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: End of 2026? That's, uh, quite a long renovation period. Are they changing anything major?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: End of twenty twenty six? That's, uh, quite a long renovation period. Are they changing anything major?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Apparently not the facade! They clarified that the exterior appearance will stay the same. It's just, you know, internal stuff, I guess.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Apparently not the facade! They clarified that the exterior appearance will stay the same. It's just, you know, internal stuff, I guess.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The exterior appearance of the site will remain unchanged, as the work does not affect the facade, the department clarified.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Good, good. I mean, it's a pretty iconic structure, right? Wasn't it built for an anniversary or something?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Good, good. I mean, it's a pretty iconic structure, right? Wasn't it built for an anniversary or something?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly! It was inaugurated back in 2011 for the 20th anniversary of Kazakhstan's independence.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly! It was inaugurated back in twenty eleven for the twentieth anniversary of Kazakhstan's independence.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Mangilik El Triumphal Arch was inaugurated on December 16, 2011, in honor of the 20th anniversary of Kazakhstan's independence.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Ah, right. And the observation deck itself, um, I remember hearing about it opening later.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Ah, right. And the observation deck itself, um, I remember hearing about it opening later.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, that was in May 2017. And it's, like, 21.5 meters tall, offers this amazing panoramic view of the left bank.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, that was in May twenty seventeen. And it's, like, twenty one point five meters tall, offers this amazing panoramic view of the left bank.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In May 2017, the observation deck on the arch was officially opened. ... The arch is 21.5 meters tall, and offers a panoramic view in all directions over the left bank of the capital.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, I've seen pictures. So you can see everything. [interrupts] I wonder if the entrance fee will change from the old 500 tenge.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, I've seen pictures. So you can see everything. I wonder if the entrance fee will change from the old five hundred tenge.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: At that time, the entrance fee was 500 tenge for adults and 250 tenge for children.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: That's a good question! They didn't mention that. But, uh, it's just great to hear it's coming back.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's a good question! They didn't mention that. But, uh, it's just great to hear it's coming back.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The article mentions the previous entrance fee but does not state what the new fee will be.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Definitely. It'll be nice to have that view back for locals and tourists.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Definitely. It'll be nice to have that view back for locals and tourists.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, definitely something to look forward to in a couple of years.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, definitely something to look forward to in a couple of years.
